  <h1>Blocketing</h1>

  <h3>Blocketing is a Fabric mod for seamless communication between a Discord channel and a Minecraft server, enabling bidirectional message synchronization and command execution.</h3>

[![Environment](https://img.shields.io/badge/Environment-Server-blue?logo=data:image/png;base64,)]()
[![Loader](https://img.shields.io/badge/Available%20for-Fabric-dbd0b4?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://fabricmc.net/)

[![Modrinth downloads](https://img.shields.io/modrinth/dt/WQAfq7OC?label=Modrinth%20downloads&logo=modrinth)](https://modrinth.com/mod/blocketing)
[![GitHub downloads](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/crunnna/blocketing-fabric-mod/total?label=Github%20downloads&logo=github)](https://github.com/crunnna/blocketing-fabric-mod/releases)

</center></div>

---

## ‚ú® Features
- ‚úÖ **Message Relay**: Sync messages between a Minecraft server and a Discord channel. üí¨
- ‚úÖ **Join/Leave Notifications**: Send join and leave messages to Discord with player avatars. üñºÔ∏è
- ‚úÖ **Server Start/Stop Notifications**: Notify Discord when the server starts or stops. üöÄ
- ‚úÖ **Advancement Messages**: Toggle the sending of advancement messages to Discord. üèÜ
- ‚úÖ **Death Messages**: Toggle the sending of death messages to Discord. üíÄ
- ‚úÖ **Command Execution**: Execute Minecraft commands from Discord (with permissions). üõ†Ô∏è
- ‚úÖ **Player Chat Webhook Mode**: Toggle Minecraft chat messages to Discord via webhook, showing player name and avatar. When enabled, chat uses the webhook; when disabled, chat uses the bot identity.
- ‚úÖ **In-Game Configuration**: Configure bot token, channel ID, guild ID and OP role directly from in-game commands. üéÆ

---

## üî® Before using this mod
### ü§ñ Setting Up the Discord Bot:
- **Create a new Discord bot application** (Follow a YouTube guide on how to create a Discord bot.) or create one here [Discord Developer Portal](https://discord.com/developers/applications).

---

## üöÄ Installation
> [!IMPORTANT]
1Ô∏è‚É£ **Download the latest release** from the [Releases Page](https://github.com/crunnna/blocketing-fabric-mod/releases).  
2Ô∏è‚É£ **Place the `.jar` file in your server‚Äôs `mods/` folder**.  
3Ô∏è‚É£ **Start your Minecraft server** with Fabric installed.  
4Ô∏è‚É£ **Configure the bot** using the in-game commands (see below).  
5Ô∏è‚É£ The mod will log in to Discord and start listening for messages and commands.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Commands
### üéÆ In-Game Setup
> ```sh
> /blocketing setup token <your_discord_bot_token>   # Required: Set your Discord bot token.
> /blocketing setup channel <your_discord_channel_id>   # Required: Set the Discord channel ID for message synchronization.
> /blocketing setup guild <your_discord_guild_id>   # Required: Set the Discord guild (server) ID.
> /blocketing setup op_role <your_discord_role_id>   # Optional: Set a role for Discord command execution permissions.
> /blocketing setup webhook_url <your_discord_webhook_url>   # Optional: Set the Discord webhook URL for player chat mode.
> ```

### üîÑ Toggle Features
> ```sh
> /blocketing toggle advancements   # Toggle the sending of advancements to Discord.
> /blocketing toggle deaths   # Toggle the sending of death messages to Discord.
> /blocketing toggle player_chat_mode   # Toggle player chat via Discord webhook (player name/avatar in Discord).
> ```

### üìù Player Chat Webhook Mode
- When player_chat_mode is enabled, Minecraft chat messages are sent to Discord using a webhook, showing the player's name and avatar.
- When disabled, messages are sent using the standard bot identity. 
- Join/leave and server messages always use the bot.
